meanings.definition: The holding or possessing of an office or position.
meanings.sent1: Her tenure as the team captain was marked by strong leadership.
meanings.sent2: He was granted tenure as a professor at the university.
meanings.sent3: During her tenure as mayor, the city saw significant growth and development.
meanings.sent4: His tenure as CEO brought stability and growth to the company.
meanings.sent5: The tenure of the king was known for peace and prosperity in the kingdom.

meanings.definition: The right to hold property or a position permanently.
meanings.sent1: Owning a house gives you tenure over your property.
meanings.sent2: The land deed granted him tenure over the estate.
meanings.sent3: His tenure as the official owner of the car made him feel proud.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of security knowing she had tenure over the land.
meanings.sent5: The tenure of the business owner was evident in the successful operation of the company.

meanings.definition: The period during which an office or position is held.
meanings.sent1: His tenure as president lasted for four years.
meanings.sent2: The tenure of the employee at the company was impressive.
meanings.sent3: During her tenure as class monitor, she ensured order in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: The tenure of the actor in the lead role brought critical acclaim.
meanings.sent5: The tenure of the coach saw the team winning multiple championships.
